channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: Journalist Stephen Witt reports on the company Nvidia, its founder Jensen Huang and why their microchip is one of the most coveted by the world.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Vanda Krefft, Expect Great Things!
channel.desc: Coverage of the 2025 Tucson Festival of Books.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: Former Anheuser-Busch executive Anson Frericks offers his insight to the Bud Light controversy, declining sales and its future.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Loretta Ross, Calling In - How to Start Making Change with Those You'd Rather Cancel
channel.desc: Activist and professor Loretta Ross discusses the excesses of cancel culture and the need for a more inclusive way to hold people accountable in the age of social media. The Roosevelt House Public Policy Institute at Hunter College hosted this event.

channel.title: Author Discussion on the History of American Cemeteries

channel.title: Susan Page, The Rulebreaker -The Life and Times of Barbara Walters
channel.desc: Coverage of the 2024 Gaithersburg Book Festival in Md.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Connie Chung, Connie - A Memoir
channel.desc: Connie Chung talks about her life and career in journalism, serving as the first woman to co-host the CBS Evening News.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Anthony Fauci, on Call - A Doctor's Journey in Public Service
channel.desc: Book TV presents coverage of the 2025 New Orleans Book Festival at Tulane University.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Cara Giaimo, Atlas Obscura - Wild Life'
channel.desc: BookTV presents coverage of the 2025 Savannah Book Festival with author discussions on Marie Curie, big tech, an FBI sting operation and more.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Keren Blankfeld, Lovers in Auschwitz - A True Story
channel.desc: BookTV presents coverage of the 2025 Savannah Book Festival with author discussions on Marie Curie, big tech, an FBI sting operation and more.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Ross Douthat & Jonathan Rauch on the Need for Religion in America
channel.desc: Ross Douthat and Jonathan Rauch talk about the decline of religiosity in America and what it means for the health of American democracy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Eric O'Neill, Gray Day - America's First Cyber Spy
channel.desc: Former FBI agent Eric O'Neill discusses his role in catching Soviet mole Robert Hanssen. The Institute of World Politics in Washington, D.C., hosted this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Book TV
channel.desc: This long-running staple of the C-SPAN2 weekend schedule helps expand the channel's programming beyond politics. Most episodes of "Book TV" feature discussions with authors of nonfiction books, usually in the form of interviews, lectures or seminars. The series sometimes includes coverage of major book fairs and festivals. Some of the notable names who have appeared on the show include David Mamet and Tom Clancy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: A guest host who shares an interest in the subject matter and a non-fiction author pair up to discuss the author's writings.
